docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 1 -- The Regional Conference of the River Plate ran into serious difficulties today when delegates of the participating countries found their individual national interest too valuable to be sacrifice for the ideal of group welfare.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 -- Goodwill messages exchanged between President Roosevelt and Foreign Minister Alberto Guani of Uruguay as presiding officer of the River Plate Conference were made public today by the State Department, a move interpreted as...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 1 -- Goodwill messages exchanged between President Roosevelt and Foreign Minister Alberto Guani of Uruguay as presiding officer of the River Plate Conference were made public today by the State Department, a move interpreted as intended to dispel fears that the meeting might threaten hemisphere relations.

headline.main: ROOSEVELT SENDS GREETING; Sees Hemisphere Unity Fostered in Montevideo Conference

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 1 -- Government and diplomatic sources in this part of South America are convinced that the Regional Conference of River Plate countries, now meeting here, is the beginning of a new method of international cooperation that...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 1 -- Government and diplomatic sources in this part of South America are convinced that the Regional Conference of River Plate countries, now meeting here, is the beginning of a new method of international cooperation that will eventually make Pan-Americanism vital and practical as a leaguing of the American nations.

docs.snippet: A "First Young Composers' Concert" was given under the auspices of the League of Composers yesterday afternoon in the intimate and hospitable auditorium that the Forty-second Street Public Library provided for this occasion. It is a good place in...
docs.lead_paragraph: A "First Young Composers' Concert" was given under the auspices of the League of Composers yesterday afternoon in the intimate and hospitable auditorium that the Forty-second Street Public Library provided for this occasion. It is a good place in which to hear music in an informal fashion.

headline.main: YOUNG COMPOSERS HEARD AT CONCERT; Modern Works Are Offered at Public Library Program Under Auspices of League LESSARD SONATA IS GIVEN Compositions by Alvin Etler, Miriam Gideon and Jacobo Ficher Also Presented

docs.snippet: Barring early strength in the Swiss franc (commercial) carried forward from the preceding week on reports that the Swiss banking authorities would stop the free flow of remittances from this country excepting those based on commercial requirements,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Barring early strength in the Swiss franc (commercial) carried forward from the preceding week on reports that the Swiss banking authorities would stop the free flow of remittances from this country excepting those based on commercial requirements, other sections of the foreign exchange market continued in the narrow price groove and light dealings which have become a significant part of the trading in foreign currencies for many weeks now.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 2 -- The ghost of the Chaco war hovered over the River Plate conference today as delegates of the five participating countries, Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Paraguay and Uruguay, mused themselves at Montevideo's race track...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 2 -- The ghost of the Chaco war hovered over the River Plate conference today as delegates of the five participating countries, Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Paraguay and Uruguay, mused themselves at Montevideo's race track and at beaches.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 3 -- The delegates to the Regional Conference of the River Plate spent today wrestling with a serious deadlock that has arisen over Bolivia's demand that she receive unrestricted liberty of transit to move immigrants,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Feb. 3 -- The delegates to the Regional Conference of the River Plate spent today wrestling with a serious deadlock that has arisen over Bolivia's demand that she receive unrestricted liberty of transit to move immigrants, merchandise and "material of all descriptions" across the territories of the countries participating in the conference.
